name: natural gas liquids fractionation | butane | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24570/documentation

This dataset represents the fractioning of natural gas liquids (NGL) to yield in ethane, propane, butane and pentane. NGL consists of 38% ethane, 33% propane, 18% butane and 11% pentane, the composition was approximated by using the yearly US field production (https://www.eia.gov/dnav/pet/pet_sum_snd_d_nus_mbbl_m_cur.htm).;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - propane extraction, from liquefied petroleum gas, GLO, 2005 - 2005 (9a114126-73b2-439f-be49-9baf778457fc); - pentane extraction, from natural gas liquids, GLO, 2008 - 2008 (ca68ff46-5aa8-426e-a5f9-93933263af14); - ethane extraction, from natural gas liquids, GLO, 2008 - 2008 (6c470c8d-51d2-4931-9e4b-8c293d138897); - butane extraction, from natural gas liquids, GLO, 2008 - 2008 (c8e7ce5f-3942-4692-8c83-aad2382b5592)]

The activity starts with NGL entering the fractionator.

The activity ends when separated hydrocarbons leave the fractionator. Energy use, cooling water and electricity are included. No emissions are included. Waste heat is considered to be recovered in a Waste heat recovery unit (WHRU).
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents the average global fractioning.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The recovered NGL stream is processed through a fractionation train consisting of up to five distillation towers in series: a demethanizer, a deethanizer, a depropanizer, a debutanizer and a butane splitter. The overhead product from the deethanizer is ethane and the bottom product is fed to the depropanizer. The overhead product from the depropanizer is propane and the bottom is fed to the debutanizer. The overhead product from the debutanizer is a mixture of normal and iso-butane, and the bottom is a C5+ gasoline mixture (pentane in this inventory). A slightly simplyfied fractioning process can be seen in the sketch below.;Source: Thompson S. M., Robertson G. (2011): Liquefied Petroleum Gas, in Ullmanns Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, 7th Edition.

exchanges.description: Composition of natural gas liquids derived from the EIA (https://www.eia.gov/dnav/pet/pet_sum_snd_d_nus_mbbl_m_cur.htm), reference year 2019.

flow.name: butane
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description: Estimation. Due to lack of process specific data, the amount of cooling water of 4.5+E-5 m3/kg is estimated based on literature value for liquid petroleum gas extraction processes (Refining Processes Handbook 2008, www.hydrocarbonprocessing.com).

Industrial value. Total energy consumption for heat from hot oil in an NGL processing plant in Indonesia. Hot oil is used as a heating medium for the reboilers, distillation columns of fractionation and defrost heater. The energy consumption for the hot oil is 30 MW. It is assumed a constant energy use in time.
